{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3490494,"name":"Ethan Boon","username":"roborio_destroyer50","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/858c86/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-23T05:24:38.758Z","cooked":"

Hello, our roobrio has died, we have only been using the bot for a few days and we taped up all our ports, we were driving it slowly and it randomly just died, we checked voltage on the power connector and it says 12v, what can we do now?

Eject the sd card and re-seat it.
If that doesn’t work, contact NI. They can help you out.

Something similar happened to us, try opening it up and cleaning the inside with compressed air or similar! That did it for us, might be worth a shot, ours had a lot of junk inside as we didn’t cover the ports

roborio_destroyer50:

we were driving it slowly and it randomly just died

Elaborate please. What does “just died” mean? No power at all? If not, what do the LEDs show? Anything in the DS logs?

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-01-23T10:14:13.065Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":94,"readers_count":93,"score":28.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":483177,"topic_slug":"roborio-2-0-randomly-died","display_username":"Ethan Boon","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":9105,"username":"Fletch1373","name":"Fletch","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67855,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/roborio-2-0-randomly-died/483177/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3490615,"name":"Scott W","username":"Programming4907","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/programming4907/{size}/168313_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-23T13:23:01.143Z","cooked":"

Happened to us twice in 2024, but I admit the lights turned on but we got a blinking light instead of solid. Generally what you should do is:

  1. Power it off, take it apart, including taking out the SD card, and very thoroughly vacuum out any debris inside, taking particular care around the SD card slot.
  2. Put it back together.
  3. Flash the SD card with the instructions, or just use another known good SD card .
  4. Insert the SD card.
  5. Power it up.
  6. Cross fingers.

If that doesn’t work, contact NI support.

Your lack of any lights means your chance of success with the above procedure is low.
